prompt: Facts: Date of Incident: 06.09.2010, around 9:00 PM.; Location: Near Shamshan Ghat, Geeta Colony Flyover, Delhi.; Victim: An unnamed male (referred to as 'deceased').; Complainant/Eyewitness: PW-1 (Mohd. Shahid), friend of the deceased.; Allegation: Appellant (Saddak Hussain), along with co-accused Mohd. Yameen and Mohd. Naushad @ Chhota, attacked PW-1 and the deceased with intent to rob.; Sequence: PW-1 and deceased were walking. Accused persons stopped them. Mohd. Yameen allegedly caught hold of the deceased. Mohd. Naushad allegedly attacked the deceased with a knife. Saddak Hussain (appellant) allegedly hit the deceased on the head with a brick/stone.; Robbery: Accused allegedly robbed the deceased's mobile phone (Motorola) and wallet containing Rs. 150/-.; Reporting: PW-1 informed police. DD No. 31A recorded at PS Geeta Colony.; Police Action: Police reached the spot, found the injured deceased who was declared 'brought dead' at SDN Hospital.; FIR: FIR No. 211/2010 registered under Sections 302/392/397/34 IPC at PS Geeta Colony.; Arrest & Recovery: Saddak Hussain arrested on 07.09.2010. He allegedly made a disclosure statement leading to the recovery of a blood-stained brick from bushes near the crime scene (Ex.PW-10/D).; Medical Evidence: Post-mortem report (Ex.PW-7/A) indicated cause of death as cranio-cerebral damage consequent to blunt force impact to the head. Injuries described were consistent with impact by a brick/stone.; Forensic Evidence: FSL report confirmed the presence of human blood on the recovered brick.; Identification: PW-1 identified Saddak Hussain in court. Test Identification Parade (TIP) was not conducted for Saddak Hussain as he was arrested based on PW-1's information. TIP conducted for co-accused Yameen and Naushad, but they were not identified by PW-1.; Trial Court Judgment: Saddak Hussain convicted under Sections 302/34 IPC and 397/34 IPC (read with 392). Sentenced to life imprisonment (Section 302) and 7 years RI (Section 397), concurrent. Co-accused Mohd. Yameen and Mohd. Naushad acquitted due to lack of identification in TIP and insufficient evidence.; Appeal: Saddak Hussain filed an appeal before the Delhi High Court challenging the conviction and sentence. | IPC: Section 34 (Acts done by several persons in furtherance of common intention), Section 302 (Punishment for murder), Section 392 (Punishment for robbery), Section 397 (Robbery, or dacoity, with attempt to cause death or grievous hurt)
